events.name: IWD '17 - Telling Our Story
events.description:
IWD '17 - Telling Our Stories is the Women Techmakers Global Event Series Celebrating International Women's Day.

International Women’s Day is a day to celebrate the achievements of women while calling for greater equality within our communities. As Women Techmakers powered by GDG Ibadan, we plan to do this by improving our programs thus increasing women GDG members through increased collaboration and raising awareness through social media.

Women TechMakers Ibadan provides visibility, resources, and communities for the women in technology as it the standard mission for WTM globally. The overall objective is to be able to talk and share our stories with the audience and empower the women in technology. The audience will also be equipped with knowledge on the various code labs that will be held. Women in Tech with startups will also get a chance to share  their work and get feedback from the audience.

events.name: I/O Extended 2017 Ibadan
events.description:
The annual Google I/O conference that displays the most newest and best innovations and technologies from Google brings together thousands of tech enthusiasts and technology stakeholders to a single location for a super awesome time. We will be showing the keynote video and taking local developers through code labs in Firebase, Android (Kotlin) and Cloud. The event promises to be a large chunk of time very well spent to all the participants.

Target audience:

•  Students

• Developers

• Designers

• Entrepreneurs

• Tech Enthusiasts and anyone who is interested in Google technologies.

events.name: Mobile Sites Certification Study Jam I
events.description:
There is more traffic to mobile sites than desktop yet most sites don’t provide an effective experience for users.

Best practice is changing rapidly so what people may have learned a few years ago may not be up to date. For companies and site owners we see better mobile design leading to significant and measurable improvements in customer acquisition, retention and engagement.

Mobile Sites Certifications is a professional accreditation that Google offers and is aimed at demonstrating an understanding in basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development.

Sign up by filling the form here 

Note:

• You need basic web development skills to take part in this study jam

• Duration is estimated to be about 3-4 hours + 90 minute exam

• RSVPING ONLY WILL NOT ADMIT YOU INTO THIS EVENT

• You need to sign up by filling the form here

events.name: DevFest SW Nigeria 2017 - Ibadan

venue.name: The Great Hall - Nustreams Conference & Culture Centre
venue.address_1: Nustreams Conference & Culture Centre, 110, Abeokuta Road, Opp Alalubosa Estate GRA Extension

events.description:
Please register here: http://bit.ly/devfestsw17 as this is the official attendee list.

GDG South-West DevFest 2017 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more! We will be having developers from all around the south-west region of Nigeria in one place to experience the best of Google technology.

Website: http://devfestsw.gdg.ng

Collaborating GDGs: GDG Lagos, GDG FUNAAB, GDG OAU, GDG LAUTECH, GDG UNILAG, GDG Covenant University, GDG BELLS University, GDG Unilorin and GDG Osogbo

FAQs

1. Why do I have to register twice? - This is primarily because we are collaborating with other GDGs for this event so meetup is not sufficient for event registration.

2. If I RSVP on meetup do I still need to register on the Eventbrite page? - Yes, you need to register on Eventbrite. See 1 above.

3. Do I need to register for this event? - Yes, while it's a free event, registration is compulsory.

events.name: Cloud Study Jams
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?

Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.

Join this meetup to get official Google training, a $70+ value, free of charge.

Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

Agenda:
Lab 1 - Creating a Virtual Machine
Lab 2 - Provision Services with Cloud Launcher
Lab 3 - Creating a Persistent Disk
Lab 4 - Rent a VM to process Earthquake Data / Introduction To Docker

events.name: Ask Me Anything (AMA) with Abiola Ibrahim
events.description:
As part of the goals of GDG Ibadan to grow the community and inspire young developers to do more at getting better and developing themselves personally, we'll be hosting AMA (Ask me Anything) with Devs who sprang from the Ibadan Ecosystem and are doing great things within and/or outside Nigeria today.

On the 1Oth of March 2018, We'll be hosting Abiola Ibrahim who was GDG Ibadan Lead Organiser from[masked]. Abiola Ibrahim (@abiosoft on twitter )is currently in Ireland, He's a Senior Developer at Teamwork(https://www.teamwork.com/). Prior to now, he has been a Senior Software Engineer at Reconfigure.io, Manchester, United Kingdom. He has also been a Lead Software Engineer at Andela, Nigeria. Developer at Konga Online Shopping Limited. He's a graduate of Computer Science from the University of Ibadan Nigeria. He has a lot of professional certifications to his credit. You don't want to miss this session with Ibrahim. He'll be available to answer the many question raging the minds of young developers about becoming successful and becoming sound developers. The time is 4:00 p.m. on Saturday, 10th March, 2018.

Come up with your questions and ask through this form https://goo.gl/forms/E31vPvnQuLyLUP752

A link to speak one-on-one with Abiola Ibrahim on Hangouts will be shared on this Whatsapp Group http://bit.ly/gdgibadan-whatsapp on Saturday 10th March, by 3:55 p.m.

Important to know:
GDG Ibadan is interested in encouraging members of this great community through interactions with people who started out little and are now doing it big in different places across the world.

The Video of the interactive session with Abiola Ibrahim on hangouts will be made available after.

events.name: International Women's Day Celebration Ibadan 2018
events.description:
We are proud to be hosting the 2018 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.

International Women’s Day, which is officially on March 8th every year, is a day to celebrate the achievements of women while calling for greater equality within our communities. As Women Techmakers powered by GDG Ibadan, we plan to do this by improving our programs thus increasing women GDG members through increased collaboration and raising awareness through social media.

events.name: Ask Me Anything with Emmanuel Obidiegwu
events.description:
The second edition of Ask Me Anything (AMA) with Devs is here! Emmanuel Obidiegwu... is our guest on this edition of AMA.

Emmanuel Obidiegwu is a Technical Program Manager at Google
Ireland. He was formerly a Software Engineering Manager at
Summitech Computing Ltd, Software Engineer at Konga Online
Shopping Ltd and Technical Lead at AYD Concepts Ltd.

Emmanuel will be available on this edition of AMA, ready to
answer your many questions surrounding becoming relevant in this
increasingly growing tech space and succeeding in the tech field.

You can checkout Emmanuel's profile on LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/obidiegwuemmanuel/

This is definitely going to be another awesome time of learning
and gaining a great deal of knowledge from our guest.

Venue: Google Hangouts On Air (Link to
join will be shared on the day of the event)

Time: 4:00PM

Date: 28th April 2018

Make it Date, It promises to be awesome!

What is AMA with Devs?
AMA with Devs, is an initiative by GDG Ibadan to improve
Community involvement as well as give hope to young
developers and young people generally that they can do very well
in tech no matter the level at which they are now. It is usually a time to learn from individuals
who have gone through the process of 'Growing' to 'Become'.

Disclaimer: Emmanuel would only be sharing his personal views with us and will not be speaking on behalf of Google or asked any questions as relating to his work at Google.

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2018 Ibadan
events.description:
Google I/O Extended is a Developer Festival that comes up yearly.
It is basically a gathering of Developers sharing knowledge about Google I/O, latest Google technologies, engaging in Codelabs, impactful keynote speeches etc.

GDG Ibadan will this year hold her IO Extended and it will feature:

Keynotes
Speaker Sessions
News and reviews from I/O 2018 Sessions
Codelabs on Google Web and Mobile Technologies.

Do not miss this amazing time with like minds like you to learn and get better. Remember to bring with you: Your laptops.

Date: Saturday, 23rd June, 2018
Time: 9: 30 a.m.

events.name: Ask Me Anything with Omoloro Oyegoke

events.name: GDG Ibadan Flutter Study Jam
events.description:
Want to start developing with flutter, but dont know how to start?

*What is flutter*

Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native
interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing
code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is
free and open source.
Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

*About the study jam*

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter
Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors.

We have an amazing facilitator, a google certified Associate Android developer will be available to work us through

*What you will learn*
You will be able to get
hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning
the fundamentals..

At the end of the study jam, you should be comfortable working with flutter and showcase your project on github

*Requirements*

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the
popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have
Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time.

*PLEASE NOTE ONLY RSVPed ATTENDEES WILL BE ALLOWED INTO THE VENUE BECAUSE OF THE SPACE CONSTRAINT WE HAVE, THIS TO AVOID EMBBARASSMENT AT THE GATE. THANKS FOR COMPLYING*

Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out :
https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

events.name: Ask Me Anything with Adeyemi Olaoye
events.description:
This is another edition of Ask Me Anything (AMA), we are pleased to welcome Adeyemi olaoye who has served the GDG Ibadan community.

Adeyemi Olaoye is a Software Engineer with 5 years experience in e-commerce, logistics, advertising, real estate and customer service verticals.

He served the community as a co-lead with Adegoke Obasa, he's currently based in Germany working as a Senior Software Engineer for Delivery hero.

Adeyemi will be available on this edition of AMA, ready to
answer your question on how to grow your skills and become relevant both in your country and abroad

You can checkout Adeyemi's profile on LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/yemiolaoye/

This is definitely going to be another awesome time of learning
and gaining a great deal of knowledge from our guest.

Venue: Google Hangouts On Air (Link to
join will be shared on the day of the event)

Ask your questions before the day: http://bit.ly/AMAwithAdeyemi

venue.name: The Zone Center

events.description: DevFest SSW '18 will hold in Lagos this year as GDG Lagos will be playing host to all GDGs around South-West Nigeria. GDG Ibadan will be part of this cluster actively. It promises to be great.

events.name: GDG IBADAN End of the year Online Conference
events.description:
2018 has been an amazing year for GDG Ibadan, and we are ending this year with online conference which will prepare us for 2019.

We have amazing speakers with vast experience that are ready to share their personal stories and how they have been able to achieve great stuffs in their career.

Venue:
This is an online conference, link to join the event will be sent out to attendees only.

What you should expect
1. How to prepare for 2019
2. Creating a vision for your career.
3. Landing your dream job.
4. Getting a remote job in 2019
5. Interpersonal skills you need to have as a Software Engineer

Speakers
Speaker name: Adegoke Obasa is a Senior Software Engineer at Delivery Hero SE,
Topic: Making waves as a Software Engineer in 2019

Speaker name: Oyetola Taiwo, GDG Ibadan Lead.
Topic: Landing your dream job in 2019

Speaker name: Funso Popoola, Software Engineer at OjaExpress
Topic: Getting your remote job in 2019

We believe this is a great time to end the year and prepare for 2019.

Compliments of the season.

Kindly share link on twitter and mention @GDGIBADAN

events.name: GDG Ibadan Cloud Study Jam
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!

Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with Machine Learning.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.
